_header: Lord what is this world weal
Subjects: evils of the time; precepts; advice; transitoriness, of world; poverty; money, use of
_description: On the evils of the times and practical advice for amendment — twelve 8-line stanzas or twenty-two cross-rhymed quatrains

BodRawPoe36.First Lines:
LOrd what is thys world weleRychesse reule and rych aray
                    …
BodRawPoe36.Last Lines:
…þis wolde seruice you both and meTo be ensample of good
                    gouernaunce
BodRawPoe36.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 263-6.
Cords,  Rose. 
             “Fünf mittelenglische Gedichte aus den Handschrifts Rawlinson
                Poetry 36 und Rawlinson C.86.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         135 (1916): 292-302: 294-6.

BLHar5396.First Lines: Lord god what y þis wordys fareBut ryal reuel & gret aray…
BLHar5396.Last Lines: …þys Tale I tell by ȝou & meffor ensampul of gode gouernans
BLHar5396.Attributed Title: Good Rule ys out of Remembrance (added to top margin by a later hand, f. 290)
BLHar5396.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.73-5.

BLRoy18Cii.Transcription:
Man be auised or [th]ou begyneThat thow haue no nede for to
                    pleyneAnd loke what a state þou standyst inffor pouerte is a ful
                    priuy peynffor what thynge ys to a man more greuousthen sodeynly
                    from man hod to fallIn pride ys lytyll gouernans
sympyll gouernansThere as pouerte ys steward of halle
BLRoy18Cii.Note:
Two quatrains, second half of stanza 4 followed by second half of stanza
                    2.
BLRoy18Cii.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James. 
             “Pieces from Manuscripts, No. II.” 
             Notes and Queries
         4th ser. 2 (1868): 125: 125.

BLAdd60577.First Lines:
A lorde what ys thys worldes weleRychesse revell or grete
                    araye…
BLAdd60577.Last Lines:
…That ȝe may haue some stuffe in storewith Inne your
                    berne when ȝe haue sowe
BLAdd60577.Facsimiles:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             “Introduction.” 
             The Winchester Anthology. A Facsimile of British Library Additional
                Manuscript 60577. With an account of the music by 
                    Iain
                    Fenlon. 
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1981: no. 131.
